item.title: How I Deploy (large) Applications via Intune
Restoring the Pre-W11 Right Click Context Menu
item.description:
A welcome change… or not? Link to heading

tldr: if you just want to revert the right click menu, skip to the ‘Identifying the Registry Key’ section

In the following article, Microsoft described their mindset behind the context menu changes here.

To quote them directly:

As useful as the Windows 10 context menu is, there are aspects of its design we sought to improve in Windows 11. The most common commands â€“ cut, copy, paste, delete, and rename â€“ are far from the mouse pointer, touch point, or pen.
